text: imagine redshift now supports the
ability to pause and resume a cluster
thus allowing customers to easily
suspend on demand building while the
cluster is not being used as you can see
here I have several clusters that I'm
monitoring using Amazon redshift console
and out of which this cluster is in a
poached state when a cluster is posited
you can perform only limited action and
I want to just resume this cluster I
want to resume this cluster now we allow
resuming the cluster either from the
console or using AWS SDK or CLI now I
want to quickly demonstrate you how you
can use the scheduled pause and resume
feature in Amazon redshift so that you
can use a repeating pause and resume
action on your cluster for example you
if you have a cluster that is being used
for test and development and you want to
pause this cluster during your weekend
so I'm just going to pause this cluster
starting on 6:00 p.m. UTC on every
Friday and then resume this cluster at
8:00 a.m. every Monday UTC time so when
you resume or pause a cluster and you
want to create a schedule you have to
provide there a role that has permission
to perform scheduled operation so as I
submitted my schedule pause and resume
as you saw that it created two different
actions one for power
and one for resume you can look at all
your schedules including the pause and
resume schedule and elastic resize
schedule in in this page
